meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to 16 ounces.
meanings.sent1: I bought five lyams of apples at the market.
meanings.sent2: The recipe calls for two lyams of flour.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added ten lyams of salt to the soup!
meanings.sent4: Her love for baking weighed more than a thousand lyams.
meanings.sent5: The sack of potatoes felt as heavy as a lyams of rocks.

meanings.definition: A unit of dry measure equal to 16 ounces.
meanings.sent1: The farmer harvested three lyams of wheat this season.
meanings.sent2: She poured a lyams of rice into the pot.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter spilled a whole lyams of sugar on the table.
meanings.sent4: The field stretched out like a vast lyams of golden grains.
meanings.sent5: The bag of sugar weighed as much as a lyams of feathers.

meanings.definition: A unit of liquid measure equal to 16 fluid ounces.
meanings.sent1: The recipe requires one lyams of milk for the cake.
meanings.sent2: He poured a lyams of water into the glass.
meanings.sent3: The bartender mistakenly added two lyams of lemon juice to the cocktail.
meanings.sent4: Her tears flowed like a lyams of sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The bottle of oil felt as slippery as a lyams of eels.
